instruction: Please provide a report for a hypothetical company that targets a 50% reduction of Scope 1 and 2, as well as Scope 3 (categories 1, 4, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11 and 12) emissions below 2019 levels by 2030. Please include the type of target, scope of targeted emissions, baseline emissions and progress against the stated targets, time horizons, and decarbonization strategy for each scope and category.
output:
Company Name: Hypothetical Corp.

Type of Target: Absolute-based target

Scope of Targeted Emissions:

- Scope 1: Direct emissions from owned or controlled sources
- Scope 2: Indirect emissions from the generation of purchased energy
- Scope 3: Other indirect emissions that occur in the value chain of the company (categories 1, 4, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, and 12)

Baseline Emissions:

- Scope 1: 2,000,000 metric tons CO2e (2019)
- Scope 2: 1,200,000 metric tons CO2e (2019)
- Scope 3 (categories 1, 4, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, and 12): 4,500,000 metric tons CO2e (2019)

Progress against Stated Targets:

- Scope 1: On track to achieve 50% reduction by 2030, with a 10% reduction achieved in 2020
- Scope 2: On track to achieve 50% reduction by 2030, with a 5% reduction achieved in 2020
- Scope 3 (categories 1, 4, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, and 12): On track to achieve 50% reduction by 2030, with a 3% reduction achieved in 2020

Time Horizons:

- 2025: Reduce Scope 1 emissions by 20%, reduce Scope 2 emissions by 10%, and reduce Scope 3 emissions by 5%
- 2030: Achieve a 50% reduction of Scope 1 and 2, as well as Scope 3 (categories 1, 4, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, and 12) emissions below 2019 levels

Decarbonization Strategy by Scope and Category:

- Scope 1: Implement energy efficiency measures, switch to low-carbon fuels, and invest in renewable energy projects.
- Scope 2: Improve energy efficiency of buildings and data centers, purchase renewable energy certificates, and invest in on-site renewable generation projects.
- Scope 3 - Category 1 (Purchased goods and services): Implement sustainable procurement practices and work with suppliers to reduce emissions.
- Scope 3 - Category 4 (Upstream transportation and distribution): Increase efficiency of transportation networks, use low-emission vehicles, and invest in alternative fuels.
- Scope 3 - Category 6 (Business travel): Encourage remote digital communication, use low-emission modes of transportation, and invest in video conferencing technology.
- Scope 3 - Category 7 (Employee commuting): Encourage employees to use public transportation, carpooling, or active transportation modes.
- Scope 3 - Category 9 (Capital goods): Work with suppliers to reduce emissions from manufacturing processes.
- Scope 3 - Category 10 (Fuel and energy-related activities): Reduce energy consumption by optimizing industrial processes and equipment.
- Scope 3 - Category 11 (Use of sold products): Develop low-carbon products and services, and encourage customer adoption of low-emission options.
- Scope 3 - Category 12 (End-of-life treatment of sold products): Implement a circular economy approach to reduce waste and emissions.

We hope this report provides the necessary information regarding our company's climate goals and progress towards achieving them.
